A9A3B68D82D74000B06C0976C06F7282.description:
Analyze the fall of the Western Roman Empire, including difficulty governing its large
territory, political corruption, economic instability, and attacks by Germanic tribes, and identify
the continuation of the Eastern Roman Empire as the Byzantine Empire.

9CE71E26681B4C8A8E0EB3AA1902EB97.description:
Explain the division of the Roman Empire into East and West, and identify the later
establishment of Constantinople as the capital by Constantine.

C77B38328DD04A4BABEFEF03C5F9501A.description:
Explain the expulsion of the Jews from their homeland by the Romans, which began the
Jewish diaspora.

77AD2940CBE34280A03E12ECE32444A5.description:
Describe the origins and central features of Christianity:
• Key Person(s) Jesus, Paul
• Sacred Texts: The Bible
• Basic Beliefs: monotheism, sin and forgiveness, eternal life, Jesus as the Messiah

7BEEBF0C6BC84FE3AFD0F4DC630FFE31.description:
Explain the polytheistic religion of ancient Rome, with respect to beliefs about the humanlike
qualities of the deities and their importance in everyday life.

FB0BC3892E8B4B8BBF562DA93EA4B839.description:
Analyze how innovations in engineering and architecture contributed to Roman expansion,
including the role of:
• Aqueducts • Domes • Arches • Roads • Bridges • Sanitation • The Colosseum

8583A1F044DE47ECBE953009984FB309.description:
Analyze the influence of Augustus Caesar, including the establishment of the Roman Empire
and its political, geographic, and economic expansion during the Pax Romana.

2A24B5F711EB4417822C03F4FCA311AE.description:
Describe the characteristics of Julius Caesar’s rule, including:
• Leadership in the military
• Popularity amongst plebeians
• Role as dictator for life
• Assassination

3CC584D8164C4BAF8E1889B38845E81C.description:
Describe the class system of ancient Rome, including the role of patricians, plebeians, and
slaves in Roman society.

CCCAE3CB89E64A48B0F25A49A1482F6F.description:
Describe the government of the Roman Republic, including:
• Branches of government • Representative democracy • Checks and balances • The rule of law and the Twelve Tables • Civic participation

124F0331526E43C494673D2B5E85789D.description:
Analyze how the geographical location of ancient Rome contributed to its political and
economic growth in the Mediterranean region and beyond.

0607E7DD34BF4DF69ED0420DBE44C64B.description:
Identify and locate the geographical features of ancient Rome, including:
• Constantinople • Mediterranean Sea
• Italian Alps • Rome
• Italian Peninsula • Tiber River

225AAD4ACBCE4BE8A8E5ECE6180EB46A.description: Students will analyze the geographic, political, economic, and cultural structures of ancient Rome.

F6085DE52EBD405FB152A2E7572C07AB.description:
Explain the unification of the Greek city-states by Macedonia, and analyze the impact of
Alexander the Great and the diffusion of Hellenistic culture.

1F2396F058D143CAA8024BAD8CF17597.description:
Describe the purposes of major Greek architecture, including the Parthenon and the
Acropolis.

C9DF153B0A7B4CE4A6A17D9997DB16CE.description:
Examine the influence of ancient Greek philosophers (e.g., Aristotle, Plato, and Socrates)
and their impact on education and society in Greece.

689D8B4A275B4586AD2D1FBBA31EF7BB.description:
Explain the historical significance of ancient Greek literature, including how the Iliad and the
Odyssey provide insight into the life of the ancient Greeks.

75D23C160C864376BBB8820A54E37263.description:
Explain the polytheistic religion of ancient Greece, with respect to beliefs about the
humanlike qualities of the deities, their importance in everyday life, and the emergence of the
Olympic Games to honor Zeus.

F556E9CDEBAB48248ACAABDF855534C6.description:
Analyze the causes and consequences of the Peloponnesian Wars, including how the
growing political conflict between Athens and Sparta led to war and left the city-states open
to conquest by the Macedonians.

F232B4E6678E41699AC061ED370B605C.description:
Analyze the causes and consequences of the Persian Wars, including the role of Athens and
its cooperation with Sparta to defend the Greek city-states.

EB24AD2E5F6F4F89BE7516641EEE36D7.description:
Explain the characteristics of the major Greek city-states of Athens and Sparta, including:
• Advantages of each geographic
location • Status of women
• Approaches to education • Styles of government
• Practice of slavery

BBF16DD7C3C84C97AEB2AB2A24C18E0D.description: Explain the basic concepts of direct democracy and oligarchy.

9FB6EF5537A04A459220F0C5F3710DE0.description:
Examine the concept of the polis in Greek city-states, including the ideas of: citizenship, civic
participation, and the rule of law.

610645F0088649F591137883E461D662.description:
Analyze how the geographical features of ancient Greece, including its mountainous terrain
and access to the Mediterranean Sea, contributed to its organization into city-states, role in
maritime trade, and colonies in the Mediterranean.

A2409D764D244FD5A2E6AEC0CBE91784.description:
Identify and locate geographical features of ancient Greece, including:
• Asia Minor • Mediterranean Sea
• Athens • Peloponnesian peninsula
• Macedonia • Sparta

A6807171E0DC41A08286F7F3417AFCE7.description: Students will analyze the geographic, political, economic, and cultural structures of ancient Greece.

2521AF2CA9224C50BC7A3DDAC165DDDC.description:
Describe how the desire for Chinese goods influenced the creation of The Silk Road and
initiated cultural diffusion throughout Eurasia, including the introduction of Buddhism into
ancient China.

8AECB0ED59A848F498A6D2C4CE5368DD.description:
Explain the major accomplishments of the Han Dynasty, including: the magnetic compass,
paper making, porcelain, silk, and woodblock printing.

E718DD653FFE455091432975AF5AB263.description:
Explain how the implementation of the philosophy of Confucianism led to the political
success and longevity of the Han Dynasty.

92112A9FBB954955BDA3EAEFAE065923.description:
Explain the significance of the unification of ancient China into the first Chinese empire by
Qin Shi Huangdi, beginning the Qin Dynasty.

A888A45ADE484546ABB059963E497962.description:
Identify the political and cultural problems prevalent in the time of Confucius and how the
philosophy of Confucianism and The Analects emphasized the concepts of kinship, order,
and hierarchy to address these problems.

B3E08F5251644719B118380D87E9A678.description:
Describe how the size of ancient China made governing difficult and how the concepts of the
mandate of heaven and Legalism emerged as solutions to this problem.

18C64604DB334B168251156989240CAA.description:
Analyze the influence of geographic features on the origins of ancient Chinese civilization in
the Yellow River Valley, and explain how China’s geography helped create a unique yet
diverse cultural identity that was isolated from the rest of the world.

08935C290BC04832AA06E7B16ED076D0.description:
Identify and locate geographical features of ancient China, including:
• Gobi Desert • Plateau of Tibet
• Himalayan Mountains • Yangtze River
• Pacific Ocean • Yellow River

0D94D2CC183F4CF0926B97CAA9B83953.description: Students will analyze the geographic, political, economic, and cultural structures of ancient China.

4AFA9A2BDF7841F2A7184CE9005432EC.description:
Identify the long-lasting intellectual traditions that emerged during the late empire of ancient
India, including: medical education, medical techniques, and mathematics (e.g., Hindu-Arabic
numerals).

C1470748E0644DA68DDDFFE2840C6BD0.description:
Describe the origins and central features of Buddhism:
• Key Person(s): Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)
• Sacred Texts: Tripitaka
• Basic Beliefs: Four Noble Truths, Eightfold Path, Nirvana

F8C1993ADA5649BB8185E44FB56784B8.description:
Describe the origins and central features of Hinduism:
• Key Person(s): origins in Aryan traditions
• Sacred Texts: The Vedas
• Basic Beliefs: dharma, karma, reincarnation, and moksha

2EA9410005EC4A8E941A4E19E302145C.description:
Describe the social structure of the caste system, and explain its effect on everyday life in
ancient India.

1EE164E4ABDC41D589CB8243C164688F.description:
Explain the emergence of the Harappan civilization in the Indus River Valley as an early
agricultural civilization, and describe its achievements, including:
• Architecture built with bricks
• Arranging roads into a series of grid-systems
• Sanitation and sewer systems

AE02D974344948D2AFE8F4AB4A1C0132.description:
Identify and locate geographical features of ancient India, including:
• Ganges River • Indus River
• Himalayan Mountains • Monsoon winds
• Indian Ocean • Subcontinent of India

467AABEA09E34C0FBDEC415488D8C2CC.description: Students will analyze the geographic, political, economic, and cultural structures of ancient India.

D4E1272B4A924FE891DD4661B1158AE1.description:
Summarize the breakup of the Kingdom of Israel, Babylonian captivity, and the return of the
Jews to their homeland under the Persian Empire.

48AA5CF5B3A145D188D21EB705D6184C.description:
Identify the importance of Saul as the first king of Israel, David as the second king who
founded Jerusalem as the capital, and Solomon as the third king who built the first temple.

FD503A76847C49B59FD6092B26C42C84.description:
Describe the origins and central features of Judaism:
• Key Person(s): Abraham, Moses
• Sacred Texts: The Tanakh (i.e., Hebrew Bible)
• Basic Beliefs: monotheism, Ten Commandments, emphasis on individual worth and
personal responsibility

EF279E88E71B4589BFE6D23D699FA22A.description:
Describe the development of the ancient Israelites, and explain the reasons for their
movements from Mesopotamia to Canaan (later called Israel), from Canaan to Egypt, and
from Egypt back to Canaan.

903649F0378A47258B4356BD524E9CB0.description:
Identify and locate geographical features of ancient Israel, including:
• Dead Sea • Mediterranean Sea
• Jerusalem • Red Sea
• Jordan River • Sinai Peninsula

1E30361F17C74B7E8EE7CB390A6EBE33.description: Students will analyze the geographic, political, economic, and cultural structures of ancient Israel.

D85335DB66C249C7A9C688C1E2996E2E.description:
Examine the cultural diffusion of ancient Egypt with surrounding civilizations through trade
and conflict, including its relationship with Nubia.

37F9D13471C443CB9E8B9A5914F9E346.description:
Analyze the achievements of ancient Egyptian civilization, including: hieroglyphics, papyrus,
and the pyramids and Sphinx at Giza.

C569DAACBF3F43499AB770CCDD53A3A8.description:
Analyze the impact of key figures from ancient Egypt, including:
• Growth under the leadership of Queen Hatshepsut and her economic policies
• Ramses the Great’s military conquests leading to growth of the kingdom
• Significance of the discovery of Tutankhamun’s tomb on the understanding of ancient
Egypt.

0C3946D01C31478A8AAC13F799D49791.description:
Explain the polytheistic religion of ancient Egypt, with respect to beliefs about the afterlife,
the reasons for mummification, and the use of pyramids

9DB513D5EBD54139BF58B36E85AAE685.description:
Explain the structure of ancient Egyptian society, including:
• Relationships between groups of people
• How social classes were organized by occupation
• Positions of pharaohs as god/kings
• Role of slaves

6B8F0BE2449A4D3E9BBE43803C0ABA24.description:
Explain how agricultural practices impacted life and economic growth in ancient Egypt,
including the use of irrigation and development of a calendar.

D668C306938C45C08E0E18F7CA36226F.description:
Identify and locate geographical features of ancient Egypt, including:
• Mediterranean Sea • Red Sea
• Nile Delta • The regions of Upper and Lower Egypt
• Nile River • The Sahara

5F47F098AA7C42978AF9F8467B472201.description: Students will analyze the geographic, political, economic, and cultural structures of ancient Egypt.

FF0C3DBBD68142328E6CEA1C23F00B9D.description:
Analyze the impact of the introduction of written law in the Code of Hammurabi, and explain
its basic principles of justice.

436C94A3AABD4C0F836477035C67C520.description:
Identify important achievements of the Mesopotamian civilization, including cuneiform, clay
tablets, and ziggurats, and identify the Epic of Gilgamesh as the oldest written epic.

7A63ED4C19824EF9BDB82FDCD10294BD.description:
Explain the concept of polytheism and its presence in Mesopotamia, with respect to beliefs
about the relationship of deities to the natural world and their importance in everyday life.

0A31555B04224F02B53BC27C77B1DF8E.description:
Explain the basic concepts of monarchy and empire, and identify Mesopotamia as the
regional location of the world’s first empire.

87369A3894574C7CB7C84D7D85048C32.description:
Analyze how advancements in agriculture in Sumer led to economic growth, expansion of
trade and transportation, and the emergence of independent city-states.

D049C5F84CDD424D85EDFA6B2F13EB7E.description:
Explain how irrigation, silt, metallurgy, production of tools, use of animals, slave labor, and
inventions such as the wheel, sail, and plow led to advancements in agriculture.

23B886652B1C4A3C914B133AC168A44D.description:
Explain how geographic and climatic features led to the region being known as the Fertile
Crescent.

E98CCDE0F1CD44118D94064899167868.description:
Identify and locate geographical features of ancient Mesopotamia, including:
• Black Sea • Persian Gulf
• Euphrates River • Tigris River
• Mediterranean Sea • Zagros Mountains

11334F0A627F449099419A50A6A223CA.description:
Students will analyze the geographic, political, economic, and cultural structures of the civilization of ancient
Mesopotamia

521D3598B8DA474791CA0EE2AD53782C.description:
Identify and explain the importance of the following key characteristics of civilizations:
• Culture • Stable food supply • Government • Technology • Religion • Writing • Social structure

CE111FEF451740C1B240B63FC7A81801.description:
Explain the impact of the Agricultural Revolution, including:
• Barter economy • Food surpluses • Domestication of plants and animals • Labor specialization • Emergence of permanent • New sources of clothing and shelter

ECE7760889094DC691175AF08412B2EB.description:
Describe the characteristics of the nomadic hunter-gatherer societies, including their use of:
• Basic hunting weapons
• Fire
• Shelter
• Tools

A3AA50957D0E461A9081E352A55BDB8B.description:
Identify the meaning of time designations and abbreviations used by historians, including: BC / BCE
• AD / CE
• Circa (c. or ca), decades, centuries

042A93E348B2463897931B7ABE74A5A7.description:
Students will learn proper time designations and analyze the development and characteristics of civilizations,
including the effects of the Agricultural Revolution.
